SENT.plain: We have cloned the mouse bcl-2 (mbcl-2) genomic locus and analyzed it in detail
The gene is comprised of two exons separated by more than 15 kb

Two species of mRNAs are produced, and DNA sequencing analysis shows that they code for two proteins differing at their C terminus: a 7.5 kb transcript codes for a polypeptide of 236 amino acids, mbcl-2 alpha, and a 2.4 kb transcript, which derives from the 5' exon only, codes for a protein of 199 amino acids, mbcl-2 beta
The gene is characterized by very long (5' about 1.4 kb, and 3' about 5.1 kb) untranslated regions surrounding the relatively short coding region
We have mapped the 5' end of the mbcl-2 mRNAs by S1 protection analysis, and we have analyzed the promoter region
The expression of the mbcl-2 gene was analyzed in different cell lines and in mouse tissues
Expression is tissue-specific in adult tissues: spleen and thymus express the highest level of mbcl-2 transcripts
The mbcl-2 gene maps to mouse chromosome 1
